name: Dinner Tonight: Taiwanese-Style Clams
description: [Photograph: Nick Kindelsperger] To be perfectly honest, I don't have that much experience cooking with clams. They've always seemed to hover in a tricky realm of bivalves. Pricier than mussels, they're usually too much for the average weeknight meal, yet...
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 pounds clams, rinsed and scrubbed well
1 inch ginger, peeled, and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, rice wine, and sesame oil and set aside.

Place a work or large saute pan over high heat. Pour in the cooking oil and when hot, add the garlic and ginger. Stir fry for a few seconds until aromatic. Add the chiles and cook for 10 seconds or so.

Add the clams in, stir well, and then cover. Cook until some of the clams are starting to open up, about 2 to 4 minutes. Then pour in the soy sauce mixture. Recover and cook until all the clams have opened. Sprinkle in the scallion, turn off the heat, and serve.
